title: ARK Invest, 21Shares join queue to offer Ethereum futures ETF - Cointelegraph
content:
Investment firms ARK Invest and 21Shares have teamed up to apply for two Ethereum futures exchange-traded funds after reports emerged last week that the United States securities regulator could soon begin approving applications.

The two proposed Ethereum futures ETFs are “ARK 21Shares Active Ethereum Futures ETF” (ARKZ) and the “ARK 21Shares Active Bitcoin Ethereum Strategy ETF” (ARKY), according to an Aug. 24 filing to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

The filing states that ARKZ would invest at least 25% of its total assets in cash-settled Ethereum futures contracts, such as those traded on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME).

ARK 21Share has filed two more Bitcoin/ Ethereum ETF applications to the SEC. Source: Securities and Exchange Commission

ARKY, on the other hand, will consist of both Bitcoin and Ethereum futures contracts.

Empowered Funds has been assigned as investment advisor for the two Ethereum products.

Related: BlackRock applies for spot Bitcoin ETF — a US first if approved

Ark Invest and 21Shares first partnered to launch a spot Bitcoin ETF in 2021.

The SEC knocked back its first two attempts in March 2022 and in January. Its most recent Bitcoin spot ETF application was filed in April — about two months before $10 trillion firm BlackRock put in its own application.

However, the SEC recently labeled many of the Bitcoin spot ETF applications as inadequate, which prompted ARK 21Shares and other applicants to add in a surveillance sharing agreement to their applications.

The investment firms are also awaiting the outcomes of Ark 21Shares Active Bitcoin Futures ETF (ARKA) and Ark 21Shares Active On-Chain Bitcoin Strategy ETF (ARKC),

Magazine: DeFi Dad, Hall of Flame: Ethereum is ‘woefully undervalued’ but growing more powerful

title: Ethereum staking continues to rise, but an opposing trend emerges - AMBCrypto News
content:
The total staked ETH was almost 28 million.

Staked ETH currently makes up 21.8% of the total ETH supply.

Ethereum [ETH] staking has developed a distinct trajectory, separate from the price trends. As more of the circulating supply gets locked up in staking, one particular metric is experiencing a decline.

Is your portfolio green? Check out the ETH Profit Calculator

Ethereum staking on the rise

Recent data from CryptoQuant indicated a steady upward trajectory in Ethereum’s total staked value. As of this writing, nearly 28 million ETH were staked, in sharp contrast to the approximately 16 million ETH staked in January. This signified a substantial increase in staking volume.

According to CryptoMarketCap, the total circulating supply of ETH had surpassed 120 million as of this writing. Additionally, data from Dune Analytics revealed that the staked portion constituted more than 21.8% of the total supply, implying that nearly 22% of the entire ETH supply was staked at press time.

Considering the daily staking rate, this proportion is anticipated to rise further. However, it’s worth noting that while staking potential was on the rise, there was an opposing trend in the supply of ETH on exchanges.

Exchanges see less and less Ethereum

In January, the proportion of the entire Ethereum supply held on exchanges exceeded 11%. Nonetheless, this metric has undergone a substantial reduction in recent months.

As of this writing, the percentage of the circulating supply residing on exchanges hovered around 8.5%. Also, this shift signified a decrease from the January figure of over 13 million to approximately 10.7 million on exchanges.

Additionally, this reflected a scenario where an increasing number of holders were inclined to stake their ETH. Furthermore, it demonstrated that a smaller proportion opted to retain their holdings on exchanges.

How much are 1,10,100 ETHs worth today?

ETH volume sees a slight decline

The decline in Ethereum’s supply on exchanges has had repercussions on its trading volume, as highlighted by Santiment. The volume chart revealed that while ETH was still experiencing a respectable trading volume, it paled compared to the volume recorded at the start of the year.

As of this writing, the trading volume was approximately 5 billion. Furthermore, this figure falls several billion short of the average volume exceeding 7 billion observed around January.

title: Vitalik Buterin Confirms Post-Merge Ethereum Centralization Concerns, Urges Not to 'Overly Catastrophize' It - Cryptonews
content:
Vitalik Buterin Confirms Post-Merge Ethereum Centralization Concerns, Urges Not to ‘Overly Catastrophize’ It

Vitalik Buterin. Source: a video screenshot, Lex Fridman / YouTube

Ethereum (ETH) co-founder Vitalik Buterin has said he is “definitely” worried about centralization risks following The Merge, the event when the current Ethereum Mainnet merges with the beacon chain proof-of-stake (PoS) system.

The Ethereum mastermind noted that Lido Finance, the largest provider of staking services for Ethereum, where around a third of staked ETH (stETH) has been deposited, could theoretically disturb the Ethereum network post-Merge.

“But I also think it’s important to not overly catastrophize the issue,” he added.

“First of all, if you have a third [of staked Ether deposits on the Beacon chain], you can’t revert the chain or whatever,” Buterin said in an interview with Fortune, adding:

“But realistically, the worst that you could do is make finality stop happening for about a day or so, which is inconvenient, but it’s not that terrible.”

Buterin also mentioned that Lido does not act as a single entity but that “they have something like 21 delegates and nodes that are running these validators that are inside of Lido,” he said, claiming that “there’s a lot of good decentralization between them.”

Lido is the largest provider of staking services for Ethereum. Generally, users who want to become Ethereum 2.0 validators and earn rewards need to stake a minimum of ETH 32, which is a high price.

However, Lido enables users to pool their ETH and participate in staking even if they don’t have the required ETH 32. The protocol distributes stETH tokens to users in return for their staked coins, which can be redeemed for ETH in the future or traded for other coins.

The Merge is Ethereum’s long-anticipated update expected to happen by the end of the year.

The upgrade has several benefits, Buterin said, noting that it makes Ethereum more environmentally friendly compared to the current proof-of-work (PoW) mechanism. According to last year’s estimate by a researcher at the Ethereum Foundation, this upgrade can cut the energy used by the Ethereum network by at least 99.95%.

“Also, proof of stake can increase the safety of the system. It makes it more expensive to attack,” Buterin told Fortune. “It makes it easier to recover from an attack, which is something people don’t think about.”

Another benefit is that PoS is more censorship-resistant. That is because, Buterin says, “miners are easier to detect and easier to shut down than just computers that are running validator nodes.”

Meanwhile, at 10:33 UTC, ETH is trading at USD 1,156, up by 3% over the past 24 hours and down 4% over the past 7 days. The coin is also down by more than 76% compared to its all-time high of USD 4,878 recorded in November last year.

____

title: How Long Will it Take for Ethereum to Reach $5000? - Watcher Guru
content:
How Long Will it Take for Ethereum to Reach $5,000?: Guide

‍The world of cryptocurrencies has been buzzing with excitement as Ethereum (ETH), the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, continues to make waves in the market.

Investors and enthusiasts alike are eagerly awaiting for Ethereum to reach its all-time high of $5000.

In this article, we will explore the factors that could contribute to Ethereum’s price surge and discuss how long it might take for ETH to reach this significant milestone.

Also read: Ethereum: Rising Shorts, Whale Interest Opens Bullish Speculation

Understanding Ethereum and its Price Movements

Ethereum is a decentralized blockchain platform that enables developers to build and deploy smart contracts and decentralized applications (DApps).

Utilizing a proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism, is more energy-efficient than Bitcoin’s proof-of-work (PoW) mechanism.

Various factors, such as market demand, investor sentiment, technological advancements, regulatory changes, and overall market conditions, shape Ethereum’s price.

It is essential to consider these factors when trying to predict the future price movements of ETH.

Also read: Ethereum’s Vitalik Buterin Moves 600 ETH to Coinbase; What’s the Motive?

The Recent Performance of Ethereum

In recent weeks, Ethereum has experienced a significant surge in price, surpassing several key resistance levels.

The price of ETH has risen steadily, reflecting the growing interest and confidence in the cryptocurrency market.

Several factors contribute to Ethereum’s price rally: the generally positive crypto market sentiment, wider blockchain technology adoption, and the surging popularity of decentralized finance (DeFi) apps on Ethereum’s platform.

The potential for Ethereum to reach $5,000

Source: Pixabay

Many experts and analysts believe that Ethereum has the potential to reach $5000 in the future. Several factors contribute to this optimistic outlook:

1. Growing Market Capitalization

Ethereum’s market capitalization has been steadily increasing, reflecting the growing interest and investment in the cryptocurrency. As more investors recognize the value and potential of ETH, its market cap is likely to continue to rise, driving the price higher.

2. Technological Advancements

Ethereum is known for its continuous innovation and development. The upcoming transition from the current PoW consensus mechanism to PoS, known as Ethereum 2.0, is expected to improve scalability, security, and energy efficiency. These advancements could attract more investors and developers to the ETH ecosystem, further driving up the price.

3. Increased Adoption of DeFi

Decentralized finance (DeFi) has gained significant traction in recent years, and Ethereum is at the forefront of this revolution. DeFi applications built on the Ethereum platform offer users the ability to access financial services in a decentralized and permissionless manner.

With the ongoing growth of DeFi adoption, Ethereum’s demand is anticipated to surge, potentially propelling its price to unprecedented levels.

4. Positive Regulatory Developments

Regulatory clarity and favorable regulations can have a significant impact on the price of cryptocurrencies. As governments around the world continue to explore and regulate the crypto space, positive developments could provide a boost to ETH prices.

Furthermore, clear regulations can increase investor confidence and encourage institutional adoption, driving up demand for ETH.

5. Overall Market Conditions

The overall market conditions and investor sentiment play a crucial role in determining the price of cryptocurrencies.

If the broader market experiences a bullish trend and investors maintain a positive outlook on cryptocurrencies, ETH is likely to benefit from this positive sentiment and see its price rise.

The timeline for Ethereum to reach $5,000

Source: Forbes

Predicting the precise timeline for ETH to hit $5,000 is complex. Yet, specific factors can impact the pace of reaching this milestone:

Short-term Outlook

In the short term, Ethereum’s price movement will depend on various factors, including market volatility, investor sentiment, and technological developments.

Additionally, brief price forecasts are prone to fluctuations, swayed by the day-to-day rhythms of the market.

However, if the current bullish trend continues, Ethereum could see significant gains shortly.

Long-term Outlook

In the long term, Ethereum’s potential to reach $5,000 will depend on its ability to maintain its position as a leading blockchain platform and attract more users, developers, and investors.

The successful implementation of Ethereum 2.0 and the continued adoption of DeFi applications will be crucial in driving Ethereum’s price to new heights. \ While it is difficult to provide an exact timeline, many experts believe that Ethereum has the potential to reach $5,000 within the next few years.

Conclusion

In conclusion, as Ethereum continues to make strides in the crypto market, the possibility of it reaching $5000 becomes increasingly plausible.

Factors such as growing market capitalization, technological advancements, increased adoption of DeFi, positive regulatory developments, and overall market conditions contribute to this optimistic outlook.

Furthermore, while the timeline for ETH to reach $5,000 is uncertain, the future looks promising for this leading blockchain platform.

Additionally, investors and enthusiasts are eagerly watching as ETH charts its path toward new all-time highs.

Disclaimer: The information provided in this article is for informational purposes only and should not be considered investment advice.

Cryptocurrency investments are subject to market risks, and readers should do their research before making any investment decisions.

title: Is Ethereum (ETH) A Security Under US Law? - CCN.com
content:
Key Takeaways

Determining Ethereum’s legal classification as a security will impact the cryptocurrency space, influence trading, issuance, and investment regulations.

The Howey Test defines asset security. Debate continues on Ethereum’s classification.

Legal clarity is vital to avoid regulatory uncertainty and to guide industry growth.

Ethereum’s journey from ICO to decentralization has shaped its status.

Importance Of Determining Ethereum’s Legal Classification As A Security

Determining Ethereum’s legal classification as a security is considered to be an important regulatory decision that would impact the cryptocurrency space. The reason is because securities laws affect regulations with trading laws, issuance laws, and investment practices.

The Howey Test, referenced by the Securities and Exchange Commision (SEC), defines whether an asset is a security. The outcome of this decision will also influence investor protection, market stability, and innovation in the crypto space.

Background On Securities And How Securities Are Regulated Under US Law

The regulation of crypto-assets, particularly in relation to securities is a complex issue. In general, securities sold or traded in the U.S. must be registered, and the registration process involves providing essential facts about the company’s or cryptos properties, business, and the security itself.

The SEC’s role includes minimizing compliance while ensuring investor protection. These regulations are designed to provide investors with access to relevant information about investments before and after investing, and to prevent conflicts of interest in the securities industry.

Definition Of Securities

Securities are fungible and tradable financial instruments to raise capital in both the public and private markets. Securities can include notes, stocks, bonds, certificates of interest, collateral trust certificates, and more. These instruments then serve as a means for individuals and entities to invest, speculate, and manage risk within the financial markets.

The term “security” covers a broad range of investments, and its definition can vary based on jurisdiction and context. Securities play a pivotal role in capital markets, enabling companies and governments to access funding while offering investors opportunities for potential returns and income.

What Is The Howey Test? Explanation Of The Howey Test

The SEC is a U.S. government oversight agency responsible for regulating the securities markets and safeguarding investors. The SEC’s jurisdiction extends to various aspects of financial markets, including investment banks, trading, financial dealings, product offerings, advertising, and fiduciary responsibilities.

The Howey Test is a legal framework used in the United States to determine whether a transaction qualifies as an investment contract and thus falls under securities regulations. The test originates from the landmark Supreme Court case SEC v. W.J. Howey Co in 1946.

The test consists of three main elements:

An investment of money,

In a common enterprise,

With an expectation of profits primarily from the efforts of others.

If these three elements are met, the transaction is considered a security, subject to the regulations set forth by SEC. The Howey Test serves as a fundamental guideline for classifying various financial arrangements and offerings in terms of whether they require compliance with securities laws and regulations, ensuring investor protection and transparency in financial markets.

Ethereum’s Characteristics And SEC’s Perspective On Ethereum

Ethereum is a decentralized blockchain platform known for its programmable smart contracts and decentralized applications (DApps). It enables developers to build and deploy decentralized applications on its network, offering features like transparency, immutability, and trustlessness. Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency, Ether (ETH), is used for transactions and to incentivize network participants.

The U.S. SEC has indicated that whether a particular cryptocurrency, like Ether, constitutes a security depends on its specific characteristics and how it is marketed and sold. The SEC has noted that if a cryptocurrency operates as a security , it falls under its regulatory jurisdiction, subject to applicable securities laws. The classification of cryptocurrencies like Ethereum is based on the Howey Test and other legal considerations to determine their status as securities or commodities, impacting their regulatory oversight and legal compliance.

SEC’s Statements and Actions Regarding Cryptocurrencies And Tokens

The U.S. SEC has actively engaged with the evolving landscape of cryptocurrencies and tokens through its statements and actions. The SEC’s emphasis on investor protection and market integrity has led to a series of public statements clarifying its position on digital assets. It has consistently emphasized that whether a particular cryptocurrency or token qualifies as a security depends on the underlying facts and circumstances, with the Howey Test being a pivotal framework.

On July 25, 2017, the SEC released an investigative report addressing the treatment of digital assets, specifically tokens offered by “virtual” organizations through distributed ledger or blockchain technology. The report emphasized that these assets, often marketed as “Initial Coin Offerings” (ICOs) or “Token Sales,” could fall under the scope of federal securities laws. The SEC’s stance was whether an asset is a security depends on the factual and economic nature of the transaction rather than the terminology or technology employed.

The investigative report on the case of “The DAO,” a virtual organization that offered and sold tokens. The SEC concluded that these tokens were securities, thereby subject to federal securities laws. The report underscored that entities issuing securities via distributed ledger or blockchain technology must adhere to registration requirements, unless a valid exemption applies.

Additionally, unregistered offerings and securities exchanges facilitating trading in these securities could face liabilities.While the SEC is open to innovative technologies, its measured approach underscores the need to balance innovation with the protection of investors and the integrity of the markets.

Examination Of SEC’s Stance On Ethereum’s Status As A Security

The position on whether Ethereum’s status is a security or not is not so well defined. While Ethereum initially launched through a token sale, the SEC’s perspective has evolved over time. Former Chairman Jay Clayton highlighted that as Ethereum decentralized and its network matured, it might not fit the traditional definition of a security subject to securities regulations.

The determination hinges on whether the sale of Ether, Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency, involved the investment of money in a common enterprise with an expectation of profits primarily from the efforts of others, the key elements of the Howey Test. The SEC’s cautious and nuanced approach reflects its commitment to balance innovation and investor protection in the rapidly evolving digital asset landscape.

Contrary to initial concerns, Gary Gensler, head of the SEC, reportedly indicated in 2018, that he also doesn’t view Ethereum as a security based on his interpretation of its historical issuance and network distribution. He referenced his earlier remarks from a 2018 lecture at MIT, where he emphasized that Ethereum was likely offered and sold as a security during its initial coin offering (ICO) phase.

Gensler’s statement aligns with the idea that the initial sale of a token could be considered a security offering, but over time, if the token’s network becomes sufficiently decentralized, it may no longer meet the criteria of a security. This view holds significance for Ethereum’s regulatory treatment and could impact how other cryptocurrencies are evaluated by the SEC.

Analysis Of Speeches, Regulations, And Enforcement Actions Relevant To Ethereum

The analysis of speeches, regulations, and enforcement actions relevant to Ethereum, offers insight into the SEC’s evolving stance. Various officials’ speeches have indicated the importance of evaluating the underlying characteristics of a cryptocurrency and its manner of distribution to determine its regulatory status. The issuance of guidance, the establishment of a framework, and subsequent statements by SEC officials have further clarified its position.

Conclusion

Determining Ethereum’s legal status as security is key for cryptocurrency regulation and market prices. The SEC’s approach using the Howey Test emphasizes investor protection, market stability, and innovation. While Bitcoin is often seen as a commodity, Ethereum’s classification remains debated.

Clarity is crucial to alleviate regulatory ambiguity, fostering industry growth. Understanding securities and the SEC’s role is essential; they govern investment instruments and ensure market fairness. Ethereum’s evolving journey from ICO issuance to a decentralized network shapes its status. Former and current SEC chairs, Clayton and Gensler, offer nuanced perspectives on the definition of Ethereum.

FAQs

What is the significance of determining Ethereum’s legal classification?

Ethereum’s classification impacts its regulatory treatment, influencing trading, issuance, and investment practices in the cryptocurrency space.

How does the Howey Test affect cryptocurrency regulation?

The Howey Test helps determine if a transaction qualifies as an investment contract, potentially subjecting it to securities regulations for investor protection.

What is the SEC’s role in regulating securities?

The SEC safeguards investors and maintains market fairness by overseeing securities markets, ensuring transparency, and preventing insider advantages.

Why is legal clarity important for cryptocurrencies like Ethereum?

Clear classification mitigates regulatory uncertainty, fostering industry development while balancing innovation and investor safeguarding in the digital asset landscape.
